alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 11 at 2:42AM PST until January 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A POWERFUL WINTER STORM WILL IMPACT MUCH OF THE REGION ON THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY... .A powerful winter storm will impact much of the region on Thursday into early Friday. This storm will deliver widespread snow which will be heavy over the Cascades and portions of southeast Washington and north-central Idaho. The snow will generally taper off Friday followed by an intrusion of bitter arctic air and dangerously cold wind chill values. ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Grand Coulee, Harrington, Wilbur, Odessa, Ritzville, Coulee City, and Creston. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
